sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"切，砍"之意。
means: chop ： 指用刀斧连续猛力砍某物，以便砍断、切碎。
cut ： 普通用词，使用广泛。指用带刃工具的切、割、砍等的行动。
hack ： 指粗暴地乱剪、乱砍、乱劈。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"缩短"之意。
means: shorten ： 通常指缩短时间、尺寸或过程。
abbreviate ： 指省去应有的或后续的部分，从而使整体缩短。也可指缩短时间。
abridge ： 多指对书籍的删节或缩短，删去不重要部分而保存其精华。
cut ： 普通用词，指任何缩短而缩减的过程。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"伤口，损伤"之意。
means: wound ： 通常指尖锐锋利的工具所致的伤口，多深及到表皮组织以下。可用作引申指打击或伤害。
bruise ： 指表皮下面的组织受损，但没有破裂。但由于血流进组织，因而出现紫块。普通用词。
cut ： 指因尖利的器械的刺或割而造成的或深或浅的伤口。
scar ： 主要指伤口愈合而留下的伤疤。

entry.def: If you cut something, you use a knife or a similar tool to divide it into pieces, or to mark it or damage it. If you cut a shape or a hole in something, you make the shape or hole by using a knife or similar tool.

example.ex: Mrs. Haines stood nearby, holding scissors to cut a ribbon...
example.tran: 海恩斯夫人站在旁边，手持剪刀准备剪彩。

example.ex: Cut the tomatoes in half vertically...
example.tran: 把西红柿纵向切成两半。

entry.def: If you cut yourself or cut a part of your body, you accidentally injure yourself on a sharp object so that you bleed.

example.ex: Johnson cut himself shaving...
example.tran: 约翰逊刮胡子时刮伤了自己。

example.ex: I started to cry because I cut my finger...
example.tran: 我因为割破手指哭了起来。

entry.def: If you cut something such as grass, your hair, or your fingernails, you shorten them using scissors or another tool.

example.ex: The most recent tenants hadn't even cut the grass...
example.tran: 上一拨房客连草都没有修剪。

example.ex: You have to learn not to cut your toenails in the living room...
example.tran: 你要知道不可以在起居室里剪脚趾甲。

entry.def: The way that clothes are cut is the way they are designed and made.

example.ex: ...badly cut blue suits.
example.tran: 剪裁得很差劲的蓝色套装

entry.def: To cut through something means to move or pass through it easily.

example.ex: I could see long canoes cutting through the waves.
example.tran: 我看见长长的独木舟破浪而行。

entry.def: If you cut across or through a place, you go through it because it is the shortest route to another place.

example.ex: He decided to cut across the Heath, through Greenwich Park.
example.tran: 他决定抄近路走格林尼治公园穿过希思区。

entry.def: If you cut something, you reduce it.

example.ex: The first priority is to cut costs...
example.tran: 当务之急是降低成本。

example.ex: The UN force is to be cut by 90%.
example.tran: 联合国部队将裁减90%。

entry.def: If you cut a text, broadcast, or performance, you shorten it. If you cut a part of a text, broadcast, or performance, you do not publish, broadcast, or perform that part.

example.ex: Branagh has cut the play judiciously...
example.tran: 布拉纳对这部剧进行了高明的删改。

example.ex: The audience wants more music and less drama, so we've cut some scenes.
example.tran: 观众想要多一些音乐，少一些表演，所以我们删掉了一些场景。

entry.def: To cut a supply of something means to stop providing it or stop it being provided.

example.ex: They used pressure tactics to force them to return, including cutting food and water supplies.
example.tran: 他们采用施加压力的策略迫使他们回来，包括切断食物和水的供应。

entry.def: If you cut a pack of playing cards, you divide it into two.

example.ex: Place the cards face down on the table and cut them.
example.tran: 把纸牌正面朝下放在桌子上，然后切牌。

entry.def: When the director of a film says 'cut', they want the actors and the camera crew to stop filming.
entry.tran: 停(电影导演要求停止拍摄时的用语)

entry.def: When a singer or band cuts a CD, they make a recording of their music.
entry.tran: 灌制(唱片);制作(激光唱片)

example.ex: She eventually cut her own album.
example.tran: 她终于录制了自己的专辑。

entry.def: When a child cuts a tooth, a new tooth starts to grow through the gum.

example.ex: Many infants do not cut their first tooth until they are a year old.
example.tran: 很多婴儿到一岁大时才开始长牙。

entry.def: If a child cuts classes or cuts school, they do not go to classes or to school when they are supposed to.

example.ex: Cutting school more than once in three months is a sign of trouble.
example.tran: 3个月内旷课次数超过一次就可能有麻烦了。

entry.def: If you tell someone to cut something, you are telling them in an irritated way to stop it.
entry.tran: (不耐烦地让人停止做某事)别…，不要…

example.ex: 'Cut the euphemisms, Daniel,' Brenda snapped...
example.tran: “丹尼尔，别绕弯子了，”布伦达厉声说道。

example.ex: Why don't you just cut the crap and open the door.
example.tran: 你为什么不能停止废话去把门打开。

entry.def: A cut of meat is a piece or type of meat which is cut in a particular way from the animal, or from a particular part of it.
entry.tran: (从动物躯体上)割下的一块肉

example.ex: Use a cheap cut such as spare rib chops.
example.tran: 用一块便宜点的肉，比如肋排肉。

entry.def: Someone's cut of the profits or winnings from something, especially ones that have been obtained dishonestly, is their share.
entry.tran: (尤指通过不诚实手段获得的)份，份额

example.ex: The lawyers, of course, take their cut of the little guy's winnings.
example.tran: 律师们自然从那个小家伙赢得的钱中分到了他们的一份。

entry.def: A cut is a narrow valley which has been cut through a hill so that a road or railroad track can pass through.
entry.tran: (在山中开凿的公路或铁路)通道，路堑

entry.def: If you say that someone or something is a cut above other people or things of the same kind, you mean they are better than them.

example.ex: Joan Smith's detective stories are a cut above the rest.
example.tran: 琼·史密斯的侦探小说比其他侦探小说都要出色。

entry.def: If you see someone you know and cut them dead, you ignore them.
If you say that a situation or solution is cut and dried, you mean that it is clear and definite.
entry.tran: 已成定局的;板上钉钉的

example.ex: Unfortunately, things cannot be as cut and dried as many people would like...
example.tran: 不幸的是，事情并不像很多人希望的那样确定。

example.ex: We are aiming for guidelines, not cut-and-dried answers.
example.tran: 我们想要的是指导原则，不是固定的答案。

entry.def: If a person or an organization cuts loose or is cut loose, they become free from the influence or authority of other people.

example.ex: He's cut loose from this business except, possibly, where James is concerned...
example.tran: 可能除了詹姆斯外，公司里都没人能管得了他。

example.ex: It's about to be cut loose from the state on which it has so long depended.
example.tran: 它将脱离长期依附的国家，实现独立自主。

entry.def: If someone cuts and runs in a difficult situation, they try to escape from it quickly and gain an advantage for themselves, rather than deal with the situation in a responsible way.

example.ex: ...his cowardly decision to cut and run.
example.tran: 他作出逃跑的懦弱决定

entry.def: If you say that someone can't cut it, you mean that they do not have the qualities needed to do a task or cope with a situation.

example.ex: He doesn't think English-born players can cut it abroad.
example.tran: 他认为出生于英格兰的选手在国外不会取得好成绩。

entry.def: If you talk about the cut and thrust of an activity, you are talking about the aspects of it that make it exciting and challenging.

example.ex: ...cut-and-thrust debate between two declared adversaries.
example.tran: 公然对立的两个对手之间的激烈辩论

entry.def: If you say that something cuts both ways, you mean that it can have two opposite effects, or can have both good and bad effects.
entry.tran: 有利有弊;两面都行得通

example.ex: This publicity cuts both ways. It focuses on us as well as on them.
example.tran: 这种宣传有利也有弊。它使得人们关注我们，同样也关注了他们。

entry.def: To cut off a supply of something means to stop providing it or stop it being provided.

example.ex: The rebels have cut off electricity from the capital...
example.tran: 叛军已经切断了来自首都的供电。

example.ex: His company is preparing to shut down in the event that their water supply is cut off...
example.tran: 假如供水被切断，他所在的公司就准备关闭。

entry.def: If you get cut off when you are on the telephone, the line is suddenly disconnected and you can no longer speak to the other person.

example.ex: When you do get through, you've got to say your piece quickly before you get cut off...
example.tran: 电话接通后，你最好在断线之前尽快把话说完。

example.ex: I'm going to cut you off now because we've got lots of callers waiting.
example.tran: 就谈到这里好吗，因为我们还有很多打来电话的人在等着呢。

entry.def: If you cut someone off when they are speaking, you interrupt them and stop them from speaking.

example.ex: 'But, sir, I'm under orders to —' Clark cut him off. 'Don't argue with me.'
example.tran: “但是，先生，我是奉命——”克拉克打断他说道：“别跟我争辩。”
